msContents.summary: The last line mentions the name of the text as Smṛtisaṅgraha. The text is about the every day rituals and code of conduct. The end of this manuscript discusses what can be done if there is a hair or fly found in the food. As Aufrecht Catalogus entry descibes the text as various compilations from codes of law. [Aufrecht Catalogus p= 1-748]. The entry in the Stabi Hamburg list is Smṛtisārasaṃgraha by Gaṅgādharavipaścit but it could be that the author is Gaṅgādhara Vācaspati. The edges of the folio are broken so it is difficult to decide about the author.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letters and numerals used for numbering folio. Folio 1 is numbered on recto and rest on verso. Last folio is unnumbered.
supportDesc.condition: Folio damaged at the edges and corners. Initial line or last line and corner content lost due to damage. Ink is faint on some folios.

handNote.desc: Mostly written well and clean. anusvāra is used mostly instead of class nasal.

additions.desc: hariḥ oṁ in the left margin.

binding.p: Thick wooden cover is used as guard.

encodingDesc.p: Folio number supplied as the last folio is unnumbered. [] are used to indicate the supplied number. In case of doubt question mark is used to indicate the doubt.
